cases.name: cases
cases.value: The cumulative number of COVID-19 cases reported up to a given day.
cases.value_daily: The change in the number of COVID-19 cases compared to the previous day.
cases.general_notes: Cases generally refer to PCR-confirmed cases of COVID-19, but may include probable and epi-linked cases in some jurisdictions early in the pandemic. Later in the pandemic, cases ascertained by point-of-care testing (POCT) may be included in case counts in some jurisdictions. Cases ascertained via rapid antigen testing (RAT) were also briefly reported in at least one jurisdiction. Some jurisdictions changed case definitions over time. Details regarding case definitions are included as data notes where available.

nt.note: Cases included NWT residents, as well as a small number of residents testing positive out-of-territory (14 by end of data collection). Cases excluded non-NWT residents (624 by end of data collection). Reporting a positive rapid antigen test (RAT) result was mandatory from 2021-12-31 to 2022-03-31, and these results were reported as cases on the NWT dashboard alongside PCR and POCT results. No more cases ascertained by RATs were reported after 2022-04-04.

nu.note: Note: 'Starting 17 Jan 2022, confirmed cases include those meeting the revised Nunavut case definitions. This includes COVID-19 cases detected either by a confirmatory (PCR) or a presumptive (rapid) test.'

Note: 'There may be a delay reporting attribution and statistics from cases acquired in Southern Canada. 12 cases that were detected out of territory have been attributed to Nunavut. This includes 3 deaths. Not all NU residents with COVID-19 detected out of territory will be attributed to Nunavut.'

pe.note: PEI reported PCR-confirmed cases. Since at least 2022-01-10, it also reported cases ascertained by POCT tests (Abbott ID Now NAAT, later adding Lucira NAAT). Case counts do not include individuals that tested positive on a rapid antigen test.

qc.note: Note regarding health regions: 'Confirmed cases are broken down according to the RSS of residence. Homeless people are associated with the support region'.

sk.note: Note: 'Effective Oct 30, 2022 includes cases who tested positive more than once >= 90 days apart.'

yt.note: Case numbers did not include at-home rapid tests or private test results.

deaths.name: deaths
deaths.value: The cumulative number of COVID-19 deaths reported up to a given day.
deaths.value_daily: The change in the number of COVID-19 deaths compared to the previous day.
deaths.general_notes: Deaths may refer to deaths where COVID-19 was an underlying cause or deaths within a certain number of days of a positive COVID-19 test. The former definition is generally preferred if multiple metrics are available. Some jurisdictions changed death reporting definitions over time. Details regarding death reporting definitions are included as data notes where available.

nb.note: Definition: 'A death is determined to be COVID-19 related if the attending physician has identified that COVID-19 was a primary or contributing factor. If the cause of death is unclear, Public Health may request additional clarification from the vulnerable setting, or a Medical Officer of Health.' Included deceased cases reported within and outside of hospital.

Definition: 'A confirmed case who was admitted to hospital and whose death occurred during their stay. A death due to COVID-19 or influenza does not mean that it was necessarily the primary or contributing factor to the cause of death.'

nu.note: Note: 'There may be a delay reporting attribution and statistics from cases acquired in Southern Canada. 12 cases that were detected out of territory have been attributed to Nunavut. This includes 3 deaths. Not all NU residents with COVID-19 detected out of territory will be attributed to Nunavut.'

qc.note: Note regarding health regions: 'Confirmed cases are broken down according to the RSS of residence. Homeless people are associated with the support region'.

hospitalizations.name: hospitalizations
hospitalizations.value: The number of active hospitalizations related to COVID-19 (non-ICU and ICU) reported for a given day.
hospitalizations.value_daily: The change in the number of active hospitalizations related to COVID-19 compared to the previous day.

ab.note: Hospital occupancy does not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported hospital occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We only report hospital occupancy 'with' COVID-19.

mb.note: Source dataset reported hospital occupancy distinguishing between those with active COVID-19 and those who are no longer infectious. The combined total is reported here.

Between 2021-06-04 and 2021-07-16, MB reported the number of patients from MB being treated in ICUs outside of the province. These numbers are not included in hospital or ICU occupancy numbers in this dataset. On 2022-07-19, they give the following statement: 'A total of 57 COVID-19 patients were transported out of province for care to hospitals in 16 communities between May 18 and June 9. The one remaining COVID-19 patient receiving care out of province was returned to a Manitoba hospital on Friday [2021-07-16], bringing the number of returnees to 45.'

nb.note: Hospital occupancy does not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported hospital occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We only report hospital occupancy 'with' COVID-19.

nu.note: Many individuals requiring hospitalization in Nunavut may be hospitalized in other provinces.

pe.note: Source dataset reported hospital occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We only report hospital occupancy 'with' COVID-19.
Hospital occupancy was set to 0 between 2021-04-19 and 2021-12-28, since no new hospital admissions were reported during this period.

icu.name: icu
icu.value: The number of active ICU hospitalizations related to COVID-19 reported for a given day.
icu.value_daily: The change in the number of active ICU hospitalizations related to COVID-19 compared to the previous day.

ab.note: ICU occupancy does not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported ICU occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We only report  ICU occupancy 'with' COVID-19.

bc.note: Only hospital occupancy was reported on this date, so the ICU occupancy value was carried forward from the previous day.

mb.note: Source dataset reported hospital occupancy distinguishing between those with active COVID-19 and those who are no longer infectious. The combined total is reported here.

Between 2021-06-04 and 2021-07-16, MB reported the number of patients from MB being treated in ICUs outside of the province. These numbers are not included in hospital or ICU occupancy numbers in this dataset. On 2022-07-19, they give the following statement: 'A total of 57 COVID-19 patients were transported out of province for care to hospitals in 16 communities between May 18 and June 9. The one remaining COVID-19 patient receiving care out of province was returned to a Manitoba hospital on Friday [2021-07-16], bringing the number of returnees to 45.'

nb.note: ICU occupancy does not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported ICU occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We only report ICU occupancy 'with' COVID-19.

nu.note: Many individuals requiring hospitalization in Nunavut may be hospitalized in other provinces.

pe.note: While the source dataset reported hospital occupancy both 'for' and 'with' COVID-19 (and we only report hospital occupancy 'with' COVID-19), the source dataset made no such distinction for ICU occupancy.
ICU occupancy was set to 0 between 2021-04-19 and 2021-12-28, since no new hospital admissions were reported during this period.

hosp_admissions.name: hosp_admissions
hosp_admissions.value: The cumulative number of hospital admissions (non-ICU and ICU) related to COVID-19 reported up to a given day.
hosp_admissions.value_daily: The change in the number of hospital admissions related to COVID-19 compared to the previous day.

ab.note: Hospital admissions do not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported only hospital admissions 'for' COVID-19.

nb.note: The hospital admissions time series begins on 2022-04-02 but includes cumulative values to the beginning of the pandemic.

ns.note: Hospital admissions begin being counted on 2021-12-08.

nt.note: The hospital admissions time series begins on 2021-08-25 but includes cumulative values to the beginning of the pandemic; the first daily value is censored because the change for that date is unknown. Definition unknown; the NT dashboard noted: 'Hospitalization and ICU counts exclude medical transfers to the NWT from out of territory.'

nu.note: Many individuals requiring hospitalization in Nunavut may be hospitalized in other provinces.

on.note: Definition from Public Health Ontario: 'Hospital admissions include all cases admitted to hospital (or that had their hospital stay extended) because of COVID-19. It includes cases that have been discharged from hospital as well as cases that are currently in hospital. Includes Intensive Care Unit (ICU) cases but not emergency room visits. Hospital admissions were identified by a reported hospital admission date or reported 'Yes' for hospitalization/ICU.'

qc.note: Source dataset reported hospital admissions 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We report only admissions 'with' COVID-19.

yt.note: Definition unknown. Value does not include patients medevaced out of territory (28 by end of data collection).

icu_admissions.name: icu_admissions
icu_admissions.value: The cumulative number of ICU admissions related to COVID-19 reported up to a given day.
icu_admissions.value_daily: The change in the number of ICU admissions related to COVID-19 compared to the previous day.

ab.note: ICU admissions do not distinguish between 'for' and 'with' COVID-19.
Source dataset reported only ICU admissions 'for' COVID-19.

nb.note: The ICU admissions time series begins on 2022-04-02 but includes cumulative values to the beginning of the pandemic.

nt.note: The ICU admissions time series begins on 2021-09-08 but includes cumulative values to the beginning of the pandemic; the first daily value is censored because the change for that date is unknown. Definition unknown; the NT dashboard noted: 'Hospitalization and ICU counts exclude medical transfers to the NWT from out of territory.'

nu.note: Many individuals requiring hospitalization in Nunavut may be hospitalized in other provinces.

qc.note: Source dataset reported ICU admissions 'for' and 'with' COVID-19. We report only admissions 'with' COVID-19.

tests_completed.name: tests_completed
tests_completed.value: The cumulative number of PCR tests for COVID-19 reported up to a given day.
tests_completed.value_daily: The change in the number of PCR tests for COVID-19 reported compared to the previous day.

vaccine_coverage_dose_1.name: vaccine_coverage_dose_1
vaccine_coverage_dose_1.value: The cumulative percent coverage of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the population reported up to a given day.
vaccine_coverage_dose_1.value_daily: The change in the percent coverage of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: Vaccine coverage calculations are based on eligiblity (see PHAC technical notes). The calculation of Canada-level coverage depends on the number of provinces/territories reporting that value at each time point. For example, if only five provinces have begun reporting third dose coverage by a particular day, the Canada-level third dose coverage will be a function of only those five provinces for that week. All Canada-level vaccine coverage calculations exclude QC beginning 2022-08-14 due to data incompatibilities (last report from QC was 2022-07-17).

qc.note: Vaccine coverage data from QC are only available up to 2022-07-17 due to data incompatibilties.

vaccine_coverage_dose_2.name: vaccine_coverage_dose_2
vaccine_coverage_dose_2.value: The cumulative percent coverage of second doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the population reported up to a given day.
vaccine_coverage_dose_2.value_daily: The change in the percent coverage of second doses of COVID-19 vaccines reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: Vaccine coverage calculations are based on eligiblity (see PHAC technical notes). The calculation of Canada-level coverage depends on the number of provinces/territories reporting that value at each time point. For example, if only five provinces have begun reporting third dose coverage by a particular day, the Canada-level third dose coverage will be a function of only those five provinces for that week. All Canada-level vaccine coverage calculations exclude QC beginning 2022-08-14 due to data incompatibilities (last report from QC was 2022-07-17).

qc.note: Vaccine coverage data from QC are only available up to 2022-07-17 due to data incompatibilties.

vaccine_coverage_dose_3.value: The cumulative percent coverage of third doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the population reported up to a given day.
vaccine_coverage_dose_3.value_daily: The change in the percent coverage of third doses of COVID-19 vaccines reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: Vaccine coverage calculations are based on eligiblity (see PHAC technical notes). The calculation of Canada-level coverage depends on the number of provinces/territories reporting that value at each time point. For example, if only five provinces have begun reporting third dose coverage by a particular day, the Canada-level third dose coverage will be a function of only those five provinces for that week. All Canada-level vaccine coverage calculations exclude QC beginning 2022-08-14 due to data incompatibilities (last report from QC was 2022-07-17).

qc.note: Vaccine coverage data from QC are only available up to 2022-07-17 due to data incompatibilties.

vaccine_coverage_dose_4.name: vaccine_coverage_dose_4
vaccine_coverage_dose_4.value: The cumulative percent coverage of fourth doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the population reported up to a given day.
vaccine_coverage_dose_4.value_daily: The change in the percent coverage of fourth doses of COVID-19 vaccines reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: Vaccine coverage calculations are based on eligiblity (see PHAC technical notes). The calculation of Canada-level coverage depends on the number of provinces/territories reporting that value at each time point. For example, if only five provinces have begun reporting third dose coverage by a particular day, the Canada-level third dose coverage will be a function of only those five provinces for that week. All Canada-level vaccine coverage calculations exclude QC beginning 2022-08-14 due to data incompatibilities (last report from QC was 2022-07-17).

qc.note: Vaccine coverage data from QC are only available up to 2022-07-17 due to data incompatibilties.

vaccine_administration_total_doses.name: vaccine_administration_total_doses
vaccine_administration_total_doses.value: The cumulative number of total doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_total_doses.value_daily: The change in the number of total doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: There is a gap in MB updates between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22. This is because the PHAC time series was inaccurate and thus excluded prior to 2022-05-22, but the MB time series dataset used in its place ended on 2022-03-31, leaving a gap. A significant revision of MB's vaccination data was also completed on 2022-05-22, so there may be anomalous values on this date since no retroactive corrections were available.

vaccine_administration_dose_1.name: vaccine_administration_dose_1
vaccine_administration_dose_1.value: The cumulative number of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_dose_1.value_daily: The change in the number of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: There is a gap in MB updates between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22. This is because the PHAC time series was inaccurate and thus excluded prior to 2022-05-22, but the MB time series dataset used in its place ended on 2022-03-31 (reported as 2022-04-02 in this dataset), leaving a gap. A significant revision of MB's vaccination data was also completed on 2022-05-22, so there may be anomalous values on this date since no retroactive corrections were available.

vaccine_administration_dose_2.name: vaccine_administration_dose_2
vaccine_administration_dose_2.value: The cumulative number of second doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_dose_2.value_daily: The change in the number of second doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: There is a gap in MB updates between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22. This is because the PHAC time series was inaccurate and thus excluded prior to 2022-05-22, but the MB time series dataset used in its place ended on 2022-03-31 (reported as 2022-04-02 in this dataset), leaving a gap. A significant revision of MB's vaccination data was also completed on 2022-05-22, so there may be anomalous values on this date since no retroactive corrections were available.

vaccine_administration_dose_3.name: vaccine_administration_dose_3
vaccine_administration_dose_3.value: The cumulative number of third doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_dose_3.value_daily: The change in the number of third doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: There is a gap in MB updates between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22. This is because the PHAC time series was inaccurate and thus excluded prior to 2022-05-22, but the MB time series dataset used in its place ended on 2022-03-31 (reported as 2022-04-02 in this dataset), leaving a gap. A significant revision of MB's vaccination data was also completed on 2022-05-22, so there may be anomalous values on this date since no retroactive corrections were available.

vaccine_administration_dose_4.name: vaccine_administration_dose_4
vaccine_administration_dose_4.value: The cumulative number of fourth doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_dose_4.value_daily: The change in the number of fourth doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: Due to an issue in the PHAC time series for MB that was fixed on 2022-05-22, this value has been excluded prior to 2022-05-22.

vaccine_administration_dose_5plus.name: vaccine_administration_dose_5plus
vaccine_administration_dose_5plus.value: The cumulative number of fifth or greater doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported up to a given day.
vaccine_administration_dose_5plus.value_daily: The change in the number of fifth or greater doses more of COVID-19 vaccines administered reported compared to the previous day.

can.note: A reporting gap in the MB vaccine administration dataset due excluded erroneous data may result in undercounted/anomalous values for the Canada-level dataset between 2022-04-02 and 2022-05-22.

mb.note: Due to an issue in the PHAC time series for MB that was fixed on 2022-05-22, this value has been excluded prior to 2022-05-22.

vaccine_distribution_total_doses.name: vaccine_distribution_total_doses
vaccine_distribution_total_doses.value: The cumulative number of total doses of COVID-19 vaccines distributed reported up to a given day.
vaccine_distribution_total_doses.value_daily: The change in the number of total doses of COVID-19 vaccines distributed reported compared to the previous day.
vaccine_distribution_total_doses.general_notes: The number of doses distributed may become desynchronized from the number of doses administered for a number of reasons, including extra doses (https://web.archive.org/web/20210129091454/https://www.cbc.ca/news/health/pfizer-biontech-vaccine-extra-dose-1.5892298), partial doses (https://web.archive.org/web/20220316141828/https://immunizebc.ca/ask-us/questions/why-covid-19-mrna-moderna-spikevax%E2%84%A2-booster-given-full-dose-some-people-and-half), and vaccine wastage (https://web.archive.org/web/20220428003641/https://vancouversun.com/news/covid-19-b-c-destroyed-hundreds-of-thousands-of-vaccine-doses).

can.note: The Canadian total distribution is slightly higher than the sum of province-level distribution due to the inclusion of the federal allocation. The federal allocation was added to the dataset on 2021-01-02 (after the transition from the original CCODWG dataset to the PHAC dataset).
